page.title: 10EMPLOYMENT (2)
page.content: A Farming Day in the 1930's ___________________________ (Interview....farmer then 14 year old) The day started at 6.00 a.m. with the milking of the 16 cows by hand. Breakfast was at 8.00 a.m. followed by land work until 'docky' at 10.00 a.m. (small snack). More work on the land followed until the main meal at 2.00 p.m. After the meal the horses were fed and groomed. The cows were milked a second time about 5.00 p.m. followed by tea at 6.00 p.m. The evening was spent doing yard work, cleaning the cowsheds, washing down the yard and generally clearing up before finishing for the day at 9.00 p.m. There were few amenities and so he soon went to bed ready for the next days work. For this 15 hour day he was paid 2 shillings a day (10p).
